description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Nostalgia Dining: Restaurants That Sell Memories.

hook.text: Some of the world's best restaurants don't just serve food ‚Äî they recreate your childhood memories.

buildup.text: Chef Heston Blumenthal serves a dish with an iPod playing seaside sounds to trigger beach memories.

discovery.text: Nostalgia activates the brain's reward system, making familiar flavors taste objectively better.

twist.text: This works even with invented nostalgia ‚Äî describing a dish as 'grandma's recipe' boosts ratings by 15%.

quiz.question: How does nostalgia affect flavor perception?
options: It activates reward systems, making food taste better
